author: Anonymous Poet
title: Functions with two variables
question: I am having trouble with functions that have two variables - I always get an error code saying that one of them is not defined. What is the proper way to type a two-variable function?
student_answer:
;; Calculate the area of rectangle (length * width)
(define (area l w)
 (* l w))
(area 11 10)
(area 4 6)
(area 7 5)

;; Take two numbers and double the higer one.
(define (double x y)
 (if (>= x y)
   (* x x)
   (* y y)))
(double 4 5)
(double 12 15)
(double 9 2)
(double 11 8)
(double 6 6)
I hope these examples would be helpful. :)
But, If you still feel troubled, please share the code that is giving error.

Cheers!
instructor_answer:
Functions with two parameters or arguments
In the example above, area is a function with two arguments, consisting of parameter l and w.
If your function consumes two arguments, then you need to make sure that the rest of the function design remains consistent.
